subclusters.subcluster_name: Dietary Antioxidant Modulation of Free Radical Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS as primary source of oxidative damage causing aging, emphasizing mitochondrial DNA and protein damage.
Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS production and comparative species antioxidant defenses linked to lifespan.
Highlights mitochondrial free radical production and decline of antioxidant defenses leading to aging.
Describes mitochondria as major ROS source and links antioxidant defenses and dietary antioxidants to aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS, metabolic rate, antioxidant defenses, and their role in aging and lifespan.
Discusses mitochondrial ROS damage exacerbated by radiation and antioxidant enzyme decline in aging.
Focuses on enzymatic antioxidant defenses (SOD, catalase) modulating mitochondrial ROS damage and lifespan.
Describes mitochondrial ROS accumulation, oxidative damage, and antioxidant enzyme activity changes with age.
Links antioxidant enzymes neutralizing mitochondrial ROS to aging and neurodegenerative disease.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS causing protein oxidation and functional decline modulated by antioxidants.
Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS as primary source of damage and antioxidant enzyme interventions in aging.
Highlights mitochondrial superoxide radical production, lipid peroxidation, and antioxidant defenses in aging.
Describes mitochondrial ROS generation, oxidative damage accumulation, and mitochondrial decay in aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS (superoxide, hydrogen peroxide) generation and oxidative stress imbalance driving aging.
Discusses mitochondrial ROS accumulation, antioxidant defense decline, and oxidative stress threshold in aging.
Emphasizes mitochondrial dysfunction, ROS accumulation, and dietary antioxidants/calorie restriction modulating aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial DNA damage by ROS and evolved resistance/repair mechanisms in long-lived species.
Describes mitochondrial ROS damage in yeast aging and metabolic shifts reducing mitochondrial ROS production.
Highlights mitochondrial DNA mutations from ROS and antioxidant defenses mitigating oxidative damage in aging.
Focuses on progressive oxidative damage by mitochondrial ROS and complex roles of reactive oxygen/nitrogen species.
Emphasizes synergistic damage from free radicals and glycation/Maillard reactions amplifying aging processes.
Focuses on interplay of mitochondrial ROS, iron accumulation, and metal-catalyzed oxidative damage in brain aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Dietary Antioxidant Modulation of Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights dietary modulation of free radical damage, antioxidant defenses, and links to multiple aging diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Dietary Antioxidant Modulation of Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on free radical-induced membrane damage and antioxidant dietary interventions preserving cellular functions.
Describes free radical formation, lipid peroxidation, brain vulnerability, and lipofuscin accumulation linked to metals.
Focuses on oxidative damage accumulation, phospholipid oxidation products, and their signaling roles in aging pathology.
